EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Stone Furnace Facility at position (0.0, 0.0)
Use-case: Smelting basic materials.
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace at (0.0, 0.0) [producing {'iron-plate': 43}, warning: no ingredients to smelt]
– Iron Chest at (1.5, 0.5)

### Iron Ore Mining Setup at position (–16.0, –51.0)
Use-case: Extraction and preliminary processing of iron ore.
Consists of:
– Burner Mining Drill at (–16.0, –51.0) [warnings: out of fuel; output blocked by item on the ground]
– Burner Inserter at (–14.5, –49.5) [warning: out of fuel] with:
  • Pickup at (–15.5, –49.5)
  • Drop at (–13.5, –49.5)
– Transport Belt at (–15.5, –49.5)
– Iron Chest at (–13.5, –49.5) [inventory: {'iron-ore': 146}]
– Burner Inserter at (–14.5, –47.5) [status: WAITING_FOR_SOURCE_ITEMS] with:
  • Pickup at (–15.5, –47.5)
  • Drop at (–13.5, –47.5)
– Fast Inserter at (–12.5, –49.5) [warning: not receiving electricity]
– Sink Inserter at (–13.5, –45.5) [warning: not connected to power network] with:
  • Pickup at (–13.5, –46.5)
  • Drop at (–13.5, –44.5)
– Belt Group connecting the fast inserter drop at (–11.5, –49.5) to the sink inserter pickup at (–13.5, –46.5)

### Copper Furnace at position (–27.0, –60.0)
Use-case: Processing copper ore.
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace at (–27.0, –60.0) [warning: no ingredients to smelt]

### Lab Power Integration System at position (0.5, 2.5)
Use-case: Supporting research with integrated power and fluid supply.
Consists of:
– Lab at (0.5, 2.5) [lab_input: {'automation-science-pack': 23}]
– Offshore Pump (original) at (–7.5, 25.5) (WORKING)
– Offshore Pump (new) at (–9.5, 24.5) (WORKING) connected to the boiler
– Boiler at (2.0, 17.5) [warnings: out of fuel; no input liquid; no fluid present in connections]
– Steam Engine (Generator) at (2.5, 27.5) [warnings: no input liquid; no fluid present in connections; unresolved fluid connection due to persistent congestion near (2.5, 21.5)]

### Pipe Production Facility at position (3.5, 0.5)
Use-case: Manufacturing of pipes.
Consists of:
– Assembling Machine at (3.5, 0.5) [warnings: not receiving electricity; cannot create pipe due to missing resource: iron-plate (1)]
– Iron Chest at (1.5, 0.5)
– Electricity network established via Small Electric Poles distributed throughout the area

### Fluid Pipelines (Pipe Groups)
Use-case: Interconnecting fluid transport components.
Consists of:
– Multiple Pipe Groups spanning various regions (e.g., around (8.5, 5.5), (10.5, 4.5), (2.5, 9.5), (1.5, 11.5), (–1.5, 17.5), (0.5, 17.5), (6.5, 16.5), etc.)
– A key Pipe Group linking the Offshore Pump at (–9.5, 24.5) to the Boiler at (2.0, 17.5)
– A congested connection noted near (2.5, 21.5) (with an identified potential congestion point around (–1.5, 21.5)) affecting fluid input to the Steam Engine

### Integrated Components
Use-case: Facilitating power distribution and resource integration.
Consists of:
– Belt connections linking outputs of mining and inserter setups
– An electricity network formed by Small Electric Poles and associated distribution links
– A Belt Group connecting relevant inserter and belt outputs (6 belts total)

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────
• Fluid Pipeline Congestion and Layout Collisions  
  – Persistent congestion near the Boiler’s lower connection at (2.5, 21.5) is preventing the proper connection to the Steam Engine.
  – Mitigate by reconfiguring or relocating interfering pipe groups, deploying underground pipelines or pipe-to-ground modules, and rerouting the connection to a less congested region.

• Fuel and Resource Provisioning  
  – Multiple warnings of “out of fuel” and “no ingredients to smelt” indicate insufficient fuel and resource inputs across furnaces, drills, and boilers.
  – Ensure adequate fuel reserves and verify that essential resources are available prior to initiating operations.

• Electrical Connectivity Issues  
  – Warnings such as “not receiving electricity” and “not connected to power network” for entities like Fast Inserters and Assembling Machines highlight unresolved power network links.
  – Confirm that all electrical devices are properly connected to a robust power grid.

• Inventory and Placement Validations  
  – Errors including output blockages and inability to create pipes (due to missing resources like iron-plate) underscore the need for pre-placement inventory checks and ensuring target positions are unobstructed.
  – Always perform inventory validations and verify placement viability before construction.
